availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Jefferson Clark (Lebanon, Marion County, Kentucky, coffee house keeper)

body.p: Lebanon, Marion County, Kentucky, coffee house keeper. Kentucky native. Married to Cordelia Ann Russell Clark. Father of Frank Clark, Martha E. Clark, Henrietta Clark, and Steve Clark. Coffee house keeper in Marion County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 545.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Raywick, p. 149B.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States(1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Raywick, p. 139A.
"Thomas Jefferson Clark (1830-1885)," Find A Grave, Memorial #N00010182, accessed August 29, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/N00010182.
